TestMode.HelpText: In individual file, set <TestStatus> "on" to (re-) start the download test; set "off" to stop the test. Once all subsystems ar up-to-date, the test stops automatically. Only Subsystems listed in the <WhiteList> (in the Individual file) are downloaded. If no subsystems are listed there, ALL subsystems are downloaded. Subsystems listed in the <BlackList> (in the Individual file) are ignored. To identify a download target in these lists, several approaches are possible: (part of) download file name, (part of) subsystem name [internal name - see C:/Sirio/Type/Subsystems/IssConfiguration.xml for examples], subsystem name with destination (<name>_App<destination>). In individual file, in the nodes <WhiteList> and <BlackList>, add list entries like that: <Entry>COMTAB</Entry> <Entry>AXIALL_004</Entry> <Entry>Gantry_1_R.Twin.Seg_2</Entry> <Entry>Gantry_1_R.yAxis_App0</Entry> <Entry>_1_R</Entry> It is NOT possible to temporarily deactivate WhiteList or BlackList entries (e.g. by renaming the <Entry> to <Entry_>. If you do not want to delete these entries, you might move them into the <TempList>. There, they remain in the individual file but do not have any influence.
